intro: Sciadioseris vaginata, commonly known as the slender false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, dry habitats. Sciadioseris vaginata is relatively drought-tolerant and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and flower structure.
